title_gu: પ્રકરણ ૧૨૪: વાકળ દેશના હરિજનનાં નામ કહ્યાં
title_trans: Prakaran 124: Vākaḷ Deshnā Harijannā Nām Kahyā

gujarati.couplet:
વડા ભક્ત વાકળમાં, અતિ માહાત્મી મન ઉદાર<RHYME_206768>; 
હરિ હરિજન ઉપર્યે, જેના પ્રેમનો નહિ પાર<RHYME_206768>.
gujarati.context: A great devotee's mind is full of God and generosity, overflowing with love; their love for God is boundless, without limits or bounds.
gujarati.title_gu: પ્રકરણ ૧૨૪: વાકળ દેશના હરિજનનાં નામ કહ્યાં
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 124: Vākaḷ Deshnā Harijannā Nām Kahyā

gujarati.couplet:
મન કર્મ વચને કરી, હરિભક્તિ ઉપર ભાવ<RHYME_206769>; 
તન મન ધન વડે, સંત સેવવા ઉચ્છાવ<RHYME_206769>.
gujarati.context: The couplet advises to connect the mind with God's command and devotion, and to dedicate one's wealth, time, and body for serving saints.
gujarati.title_gu: પ્રકરણ ૧૨૪: વાકળ દેશના હરિજનનાં નામ કહ્યાં
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 124: Vākaḷ Deshnā Harijannā Nām Kahyā

gujarati.couplet:
જેવા જન વાકળના, તેવા જ કાનમ માંઇ; 
વિશવાસી વિકાર વિના, કપટ છળ નહી કાંઈ.
gujarati.context: Those with corrupt hearts have corrupt ears; faithless ones suffer no calamity.
gujarati.title_gu: પ્રકરણ ૧૨૪: વાકળ દેશના હરિજનનાં નામ કહ્યાં
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 124: Vākaḷ Deshnā Harijannā Nām Kahyā

gujarati.couplet:
સદા એ જન સુખિયા, જેને પ્રકટ પ્રભુશું પ્રીત<RHYME_206771>; 
એવા જન અમળનાં, હવે લખું નામ કિંચિત<RHYME_206771>.
gujarati.context: Those who always think of others and are devoted to God are truly happy; I will now write the name of such a person, even if it's just a little bit.
gujarati.title_gu: પ્રકરણ ૧૨૪: વાકળ દેશના હરિજનનાં નામ કહ્યાં
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 124: Vākaḷ Deshnā Harijannā Nām Kahyā

gujarati.couplet:
વડા ભક્ત વડોદરા માંઇ<RHYME_206772>, જેને અતિ હેત હરિ માંઇ; 
કણબી ભક્ત કહીએ વનમાળી, જેણે બીક જગતની ટાળી.
gujarati.context: The devoted worshipper is found in Vadodara, who has surrendered their everything to God; another devotee says that the one who has conquered the world's turmoil is like a forest where all animals reside peacefully.
gujarati.title_gu: પ્રકરણ ૧૨૪: વાકળ દેશના હરિજનનાં નામ કહ્યાં
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 124: Vākaḷ Deshnā Harijannā Nām Kahyā

gujarati.couplet:
નાથજી ને વળી વનમાળી, પ્રભુદાસની ભાવના ભાળી; 
ભગવાનદાસ ને કેસુર<RHYME_206774>, પીતાંબર ભૂખણ જરૂર<RHYME_206774>.
gujarati.context: The couplet compares two people: Nathji's words are like a forest of trees, and Prabudasa's emotions are connected to his heart; while Bhagavadasa is like a thirsty crow, constantly seeking something to quench his hunger.
gujarati.title_gu: પ્રકરણ ૧૨૪: વાકળ દેશના હરિજનનાં નામ કહ્યાં
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 124: Vākaḷ Deshnā Harijannā Nām Kahyā

gujarati.couplet:
જગજીવન ને નારાયણ<RHYME_206775>, પ્રભુ પુરુષોત્તમ ઘેલો જાણ<RHYME_206775>; 
એહ આદિ કણબી અપાર, ભજે નારાયણ નરનાર્ય.
gujarati.context: Life is a gift from Lord Naran (God), and one should cherish it; let us worship Naran Narayan, the ultimate being.
gujarati.title_gu: પ્રકરણ ૧૨૪: વાકળ દેશના હરિજનનાં નામ કહ્યાં
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 124: Vākaḷ Deshnā Harijannā Nām Kahyā

gujarati.couplet:
દ્વિજ ભક્ત નાનોભાઈ નામ<RHYME_206776>, ભજે હરિ તજી મન કામ<RHYME_206776>; 
રામચંદ્ર હરિચંદ્રભાઈ, શોભારામ કહીએ શાસ્ત્રીમાંઇ<RHYME_206772>.
gujarati.context: A devotee's true name is humility, and he worships Hari with a pure mind; Ramchandrachandrabaai, known as Shobharam, is a scholar of the scriptures.
gujarati.title_gu: પ્રકરણ ૧૨૪: વાકળ દેશના હરિજનનાં નામ કહ્યાં
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 124: Vākaḷ Deshnā Harijannā Nām Kahyā

gujarati.couplet:
બાપુ જેઠો ને વ્રજજીવન, ભક્ત બ્રાહ્મણમાં ધન્ય ધન્ય; 
સદાશિવ ધનેશ્વર નામ<RHYME_206776>, ભક્ત ખુશાલ લક્ષમીરામ<RHYME_206776>.
gujarati.context: The father-in-law's words to the groom are that a virtuous life is blessed, and the devotee's wealth lies in Brahman; Lord Sadashiv Dhaneshwar is the name of our prosperity.
gujarati.title_gu: પ્રકરણ ૧૨૪: વાકળ દેશના હરિજનનાં નામ કહ્યાં
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 124: Vākaḷ Deshnā Harijannā Nām Kahyā

gujarati.couplet:
એહ આદિ દ્વિજ અપ્રમીત<RHYME_206771>, સરવેને શ્રીસ્વામીશું પ્રીત<RHYME_206771>; 
શેઠ પ્રભુદાસ હરજીવન<RHYME_206777>, બાપુભાઈ પ્રેમાનંદ જન<RHYME_206777>.
gujarati.context: This couplet expresses the joy and love of being reunited with a loved one, likening it to the union of Shri Swami and his devotees. It praises the couple's eternal love, comparing it to the divine bond between Prabhuadas Harjivan and Premabhai Premandan.
gujarati.title_gu: પ્રકરણ ૧૨૪: વાકળ દેશના હરિજનનાં નામ કહ્યાં
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 124: Vākaḷ Deshnā Harijannā Nām Kahyā

gujarati.couplet:
વૃંદાવન ગંગાદાસ વણિક<RHYME_206778>, ભજ્યા હરિ તે કરી વિવેક<RHYME_206778>; 
કાછિયો પુરુષોત્તમ જન<RHYME_206777>, જેણે નિજ કુળ કર્યું પાવન<RHYME_206777>.
gujarati.context: The merciful Lord accepted Vrundavan's devotion, which arose from his self-realization. The great soul, Purushottam, created his own family and was blessed by the divine.
gujarati.title_gu: પ્રકરણ ૧૨૪: વાકળ દેશના હરિજનનાં નામ કહ્યાં
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 124: Vākaḷ Deshnā Harijannā Nām Kahyā

gujarati.couplet:
ખુશાલ ભાઈજી રણછોડ<RHYME_206779>, હરિ જેરામ ઈશ્વર જોડ<RHYME_206779>; 
પ્રેમી ભક્ત છે વામનજીભાઈ, એહ આદિ છે કાછિયા માંઇ<RHYME_206772>.
gujarati.context: Brothers filled with joy and faith are bound to the Lord; Vamanji, a loving devotee, is eternal in Kachhiya Mandi.
gujarati.title_gu: પ્રકરણ ૧૨૪: વાકળ દેશના હરિજનનાં નામ કહ્યાં
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 124: Vākaḷ Deshnā Harijannā Nām Kahyā

gujarati.couplet:
જન તંબોલી છે નાનબાઈ<RHYME_206780>, તેના સુત નારાયણભાઈ<RHYME_206780>; 
દક્ષણી ભક્ત નારાયણ રાઓ<RHYME_206781>, ઢુંઢું રાઓનો ઢળિયો દાઓ<RHYME_206781>.
gujarati.context: The couplet describes a person named Tamboli who is a devotee of Lord Narayana, with the phrase "Narayanrao" implying devotion to God. The poem expresses gratitude and humility in the presence of God, using phrases like "Dakhani Bhakt" (devotee from South India) and "Rao's mercy".
gujarati.title_gu: પ્રકરણ ૧૨૪: વાકળ દેશના હરિજનનાં નામ કહ્યાં
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 124: Vākaḷ Deshnā Harijannā Nām Kahyā

gujarati.couplet:
ચિમનરાઓ પ્રભુ દ્વિજ એક<RHYME_206778>, જાણે સાર અસાર વિવેક<RHYME_206778>; 
દક્ષણી ભક્ત છે અંબાબાઈ<RHYME_206782>, દ્વિજ દક્ષણી દાજીબાભાઈ<RHYME_206782>.
gujarati.context: There is only one Lord who is the ultimate reality, and one should understand that true bliss lies in selfless service; Amba Bai is a devotee from South India.
gujarati.title_gu: પ્રકરણ ૧૨૪: વાકળ દેશના હરિજનનાં નામ કહ્યાં
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 124: Vākaḷ Deshnā Harijannā Nām Kahyā

gujarati.couplet:
શિલાટ ફતોજી તારાચંદ<RHYME_206783>, મોતી હીરજી ને અમીચંદ<RHYME_206783>; 
ખત્રી ભક્ત નથુ અંબારામ<RHYME_206784>, પુરુષોત્તમ દયારામ જેરામ<RHYME_206784>.
gujarati.context: The couplet describes the qualities of a true devotee, emphasizing that they should be selfless and devoted to God, rather than seeking personal gain or fame.
gujarati.title_gu: પ્રકરણ ૧૨૪: વાકળ દેશના હરિજનનાં નામ કહ્યાં
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 124: Vākaḷ Deshnā Harijannā Nām Kahyā

gujarati.couplet:
નંદલાલ તારાચંદ નામ<RHYME_206776>, ભક્ત સોની સારો ગંગારામ<RHYME_206776>; 
ભક્ત સુતાર છે ધર્મદાસ<RHYME_206785>, જેને પ્રભુનો છે વિશવાસ<RHYME_206785>.
gujarati.context:
Here is a 1-2 line summarization of the Gujarati couplet:

Nandalaal Tarachand's name is that of a devoted son, as pious as Ganga Ram. He is a devotee of God, having unwavering faith in His power.
gujarati.title_gu: પ્રકરણ ૧૨૪: વાકળ દેશના હરિજનનાં નામ કહ્યાં
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 124: Vākaḷ Deshnā Harijannā Nām Kahyā

gujarati.couplet:
ભક્ત લુવાર મૂળજી નામ<RHYME_206776>, હરિજન લુવાણો જેરામ<RHYME_206776>; 
બેચર આદિ જણસાલિ જન<RHYME_206777>, કરે સ્વામીશ્રીજીનું ભજન<RHYME_206777>.
gujarati.context: A devotee's love is rooted in the name of God, and their humility brings them closer to Him; they praise God with a pure heart, free from worldly desires.
gujarati.title_gu: પ્રકરણ ૧૨૪: વાકળ દેશના હરિજનનાં નામ કહ્યાં
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 124: Vākaḷ Deshnā Harijannā Nām Kahyā

gujarati.couplet:
એહાદિ બહુ બાઈ ભાઈ, વસે શહેર વડોદરા માંઇ<RHYME_206772>; 
જોઈ અનંત પર્ચા ચમત્કાર, રહે મગન મને નરનાર્ય.
gujarati.context: This Gujarati couplet is about a brother and sister who have been separated for a long time, but they can't forget each other's love and are stuck in memories of their past life together.
gujarati.title_gu: પ્રકરણ ૧૨૪: વાકળ દેશના હરિજનનાં નામ કહ્યાં
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 124: Vākaḷ Deshnā Harijannā Nām Kahyā

gujarati.couplet:
કણબી ભક્ત પ્રાગજી દાજી, વસે ગામ શિશુવેરે રાજી; 
કોળી ભક્ત બાજીભાઈ કહીએ<RHYME_206787>, એહ ગામ આંબોદરે લહીએ<RHYME_206787>.
gujarati.context:
Here is a 1-2 line summarization of the Gujarati couplet:

The devotees of Pragjyotishwar and Koli are united, with their hearts filled with joy and love in this village; they share stories of devotion and enthusiasm.
gujarati.title_gu: પ્રકરણ ૧૨૪: વાકળ દેશના હરિજનનાં નામ કહ્યાં
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 124: Vākaḷ Deshnā Harijannā Nām Kahyā

gujarati.couplet:
કણબી ભક્ત છે માવજીભાઈ<RHYME_206788>, કાજુ જન રહે કપુરાઈ<RHYME_206788>; 
કણબી ભક્ત પ્રભુદાસભાઈ<RHYME_206788>, હરિજન એક લાડુબાઈ<RHYME_206788>.
gujarati.context: A devotee is one who surrenders to the divine, and a true follower stays in His fold. A true devotee is one who has complete faith and trust in God, like Prabhu Dasbhai or Harijan.
gujarati.title_gu: પ્રકરણ ૧૨૪: વાકળ દેશના હરિજનનાં નામ કહ્યાં
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 124: Vākaḷ Deshnā Harijannā Nām Kahyā

gujarati.couplet:
ભક્ત મેતર રામો છે નામ<RHYME_206776>, એહ જન વસે છાણી ગામ<RHYME_206776>; 
કણબી ભક્ત ગણેશજી જાણો, કોળી ભક્ત કરાર પ્રમાણો.
gujarati.context: The devotee is known by the name of Rama, and this community lives in harmony with their village; a devotee's worth is recognized by Ganesha, while a Koli devotee's worth is measured by their deeds.
gujarati.title_gu: પ્રકરણ ૧૨૪: વાકળ દેશના હરિજનનાં નામ કહ્યાં
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 124: Vākaḷ Deshnā Harijannā Nām Kahyā

gujarati.couplet:
શેઠ ભક્ત મોરારજીભાઈ, એહાદિ જન સાંકર્દા માંઇ<RHYME_206772>; 
કોળી ભક્ત કાનભાઈ કહીએ<RHYME_206787>, પ્રતાપસિંઘ અણઘડે લહીએ<RHYME_206787>.
gujarati.context: The couplet praises Morarijibhai, a devotee who has transcended worldly desires, and Kandalabhai, another devotee, says that the mighty lion-like warrior (Pratapsingh) will not dare to attack those who have reached this state.
gujarati.title_gu: પ્રકરણ ૧૨૪: વાકળ દેશના હરિજનનાં નામ કહ્યાં
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 124: Vākaḷ Deshnā Harijannā Nām Kahyā

gujarati.couplet:
કણબી ભક્ત દયાળજીભાઈ<RHYME_206790>, જાદવ રણછોડ વજો દેસાઈ<RHYME_206790>; 
બાજી ઝવેર પુરુષોત્તમ<RHYME_206791>, બાઈ સાકર ને વળી પ્રેમ<RHYME_206791>.
gujarati.context: A devoted worshipper's love is like a pearl, precious and rare; a true lover's affection is like sugar, sweetening the heart.
gujarati.title_gu: પ્રકરણ ૧૨૪: વાકળ દેશના હરિજનનાં નામ કહ્યાં
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 124: Vākaḷ Deshnā Harijannā Nām Kahyā

gujarati.couplet:
કોળી ભક્ત બાજી નારભાઈ, વસે ગામ એ ગોરવા માંઇ<RHYME_206772>; 
કણબી ભક્ત રુગનાથ નામ<RHYME_206776>, જીજી વિઠલ લક્ષમીરામ<RHYME_206776>.
gujarati.context: A devotee's heart is pure and true, in the village where love for God grows. The name of the Lord Rughnath is revered, with Lakshmi and Vitthal worshiped there.
gujarati.title_gu: પ્રકરણ ૧૨૪: વાકળ દેશના હરિજનનાં નામ કહ્યાં
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 124: Vākaḷ Deshnā Harijannā Nām Kahyā

gujarati.couplet:
ભક્ત નરહર ને કાશીભાઈ<RHYME_206792>, હરિજન છે રળીયાત બાઈ<RHYME_206792>; 
ભક્ત સુતાર ગીરધર ગણિયે, કોળી જોરો ઉમેદ ભણિયે.
gujarati.context: A devotee's true nature is revealed only when they surrender to God, like a cobbler's skill is seen in their handiwork.
gujarati.title_gu: પ્રકરણ ૧૨૪: વાકળ દેશના હરિજનનાં નામ કહ્યાં
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 124: Vākaḷ Deshnā Harijannā Nām Kahyā

gujarati.couplet:

gujarati.title_gu: પ્રકરણ ૧૨૪: વાકળ દેશના હરિજનનાં નામ કહ્યાં
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 124: Vākaḷ Deshnā Harijannā Nām Kahyā

gujarati.couplet:

gujarati.context: The couplet describes the devotion of Daji Giridhar Bhagavad, who is deeply pained to see the suffering of Harinam, a lowly caste man, and prays to God for his salvation.
gujarati.title_gu: પ્રકરણ ૧૨૪: વાકળ દેશના હરિજનનાં નામ કહ્યાં
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 124: Vākaḷ Deshnā Harijannā Nām Kahyā

gujarati.context: In this Gujarati couplet, the speaker describes how many devotees, including oneself (એહ), experience God's presence and salvation, with even a lowly "koli" (untouchable) achieving great spiritual heights.
gujarati.title_gu: પ્રકરણ ૧૨૪: વાકળ દેશના હરિજનનાં નામ કહ્યાં

gujarati.couplet:

gujarati.context:
Here is a 1-2 line summary of the Gujarati couplet:

The devoted soul, freed from worldly desires, finds peace in the name of God; their noble heart becomes pure and calm.
gujarati.title_gu: પ્રકરણ ૧૨૪: વાકળ દેશના હરિજનનાં નામ કહ્યાં

gujarati.context: The devotee Bapubhai is a true warrior, and his life's purpose is like the Pipli tree that stands firm; similarly, Harjivan, the twice-born, has become charming to the world, just like Gaurishankar.
gujarati.title_gu: પ્રકરણ ૧૨૪: વાકળ દેશના હરિજનનાં નામ કહ્યાં
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 124: Vākaḷ Deshnā Harijannā Nām Kahyā

gujarati.context:
Here is a 1-2 line summary of the Gujarati couplet:

Lord Ramchandra is compared to Nagji, whose thirst was quenched by Trikam; similarly, Sheth Bhakt Ambavidas' devotion is eternal and unquenchable.
gujarati.title_gu: પ્રકરણ ૧૨૪: વાકળ દેશના હરિજનનાં નામ કહ્યાં
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 124: Vākaḷ Deshnā Harijannā Nām Kahyā

gujarati.couplet:

gujarati.title_gu: પ્રકરણ ૧૨૪: વાકળ દેશના હરિજનનાં નામ કહ્યાં
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 124: Vākaḷ Deshnā Harijannā Nām Kahyā

gujarati.couplet:

gujarati.context: The couplet describes a devotee (bhakta) named Udhdav, who is completely devoted to the Lord and has reached a state of spiritual realization, finding solace in God's presence.
gujarati.title_gu: પ્રકરણ ૧૨૪: વાકળ દેશના હરિજનનાં નામ કહ્યાં
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 124: Vākaḷ Deshnā Harijannā Nām Kahyā

gujarati.couplet:
પુરુષોત્તમ જીજીભાઈ જન<RHYME_206777>, નરહર ગિરધર પાવન<RHYME_206777>;

gujarati.context: Men and women who are devoted to God are blessed with three attributes: love, devotion, and faithfulness, which bring them close to the ultimate truth. This spiritual connection is considered more valuable than even the highest human achievement.
gujarati.title_gu: પ્રકરણ ૧૨૪: વાકળ દેશના હરિજનનાં નામ કહ્યાં
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 124: Vākaḷ Deshnā Harijannā Nām Kahyā

Here is a summary of the Gujarati couplet in English:

God is one and only, no differences; The devotee says, "I take refuge at His feet."
gujarati.title_gu: પ્રકરણ ૧૨૪: વાકળ દેશના હરિજનનાં નામ કહ્યાં

gujarati.couplet:

gujarati.context: A devotee named Madohbhai worships Lord Hari with sincerity and devotion; a poor soul like myself, Keshavadasi, is deceived by false hopes of meeting him.
gujarati.title_gu: પ્રકરણ ૧૨૪: વાકળ દેશના હરિજનનાં નામ કહ્યાં

gujarati.title_gu: પ્રકરણ ૧૨૪: વાકળ દેશના હરિજનનાં નામ કહ્યાં

gujarati.title_gu: પ્રકરણ ૧૨૪: વાકળ દેશના હરિજનનાં નામ કહ્યાં

gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 124: Vākaḷ Deshnā Harijannā Nām Kahyā

gujarati.title_gu: પ્રકરણ ૧૨૪: વાકળ દેશના હરિજનનાં નામ કહ્યાં
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 124: Vākaḷ Deshnā Harijannā Nām Kahyā

gujarati.title_gu: પ્રકરણ ૧૨૪: વાકળ દેશના હરિજનનાં નામ કહ્યાં

gujarati.context: A devout person (dvij bhakt) is one who has reached the ultimate goal of self-realization, whereas a worldly person (kaju bhakt) is stuck in worldly pleasures.
gujarati.title_gu: પ્રકરણ ૧૨૪: વાકળ દેશના હરિજનનાં નામ કહ્યાં

gujarati.title_gu: પ્રકરણ ૧૨૪: વાકળ દેશના હરિજનનાં નામ કહ્યાં

gujarati.couplet:

gujarati.context: A true devotee is not one who begs for alms, but one who has dedicated their life to God; they worship and serve the Lord with utmost devotion.
gujarati.title_gu: પ્રકરણ ૧૨૪: વાકળ દેશના હરિજનનાં નામ કહ્યાં
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 124: Vākaḷ Deshnā Harijannā Nām Kahyā

gujarati.couplet:

gujarati.context: The devotee is like a gem in the treasure of Tulsi's divine realm, and his abode is where God resides. He says that even Sheth Hiriya (a demon) would be considered Purushottam (the supreme being) by such a devotee.
gujarati.title_gu: પ્રકરણ ૧૨૪: વાકળ દેશના હરિજનનાં નામ કહ્યાં
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 124: Vākaḷ Deshnā Harijannā Nām Kahyā

gujarati.couplet:
એહ રહે રણાપુર માંઇ<RHYME_206772>, ભજે શ્યામસુંદર સુખદાઈ;

gujarati.context:

One's soul resides in Ranapura, worshipping Shyamsundar with joy; one's heart and mind are devoted to God, without a moment of distraction.

gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 124: Vākaḷ Deshnā Harijannā Nām Kahyā

gujarati.couplet:
એહાદિ સતસંગીની ટોળી, ભજે હરિ રહે ગામ દેરોલી; 
કણબી ભક્ત કહીએ કાશીદાસ<RHYME_206810>, એહાદિ જન પાણેથે વાસ<RHYME_206810>.
gujarati.context: This Gujarati couplet describes a group of saints (sat sangini) who worship God in the village and are blessed by His presence. It is said that even ordinary people like KashiDas can attain spiritual growth if they follow the path shown by these saints.
gujarati.title_gu: પ્રકરણ ૧૨૪: વાકળ દેશના હરિજનનાં નામ કહ્યાં
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 124: Vākaḷ Deshnā Harijannā Nām Kahyā

gujarati.couplet:
કણબી ભક્ત જોરોભાઈ જન<RHYME_206777>, પુરુષોત્તમ ભીખો પાવન<RHYME_206777>; 
વળી ભક્ત એક વણારશી, એહ જન રાજપરાવાસી.
gujarati.context: A devoted soul is like a beggar seeking God's mercy, and this world is just a temporary residence.
gujarati.title_gu: પ્રકરણ ૧૨૪: વાકળ દેશના હરિજનનાં નામ કહ્યાં
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 124: Vākaḷ Deshnā Harijannā Nām Kahyā

gujarati.couplet:
દલો બાજી કેશવ જેરામ<RHYME_206776>, કણબી ભક્ત રહે ગામ ભદામ<RHYME_206776>; 
દ્વિજ ભક્ત કહીએ સુખરામ<RHYME_206776>, કાજુ ભક્ત રહે કન્યાળી ગામ<RHYME_206776>.
gujarati.context: A devout person who is devoted to God lives in a peaceful village, while one who is attached to wealth and material possessions resides in a village filled with poverty and struggle.
gujarati.title_gu: પ્રકરણ ૧૨૪: વાકળ દેશના હરિજનનાં નામ કહ્યાં
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 124: Vākaḷ Deshnā Harijannā Nām Kahyā

gujarati.couplet:
ભક્ત કણબી કહીએ રાયજી, વસે ગામ ઝાંઝર માંયજી; 
દ્વિજ ભક્ત છે ગોવિંદરામ<RHYME_206776>, કણબી તુલજો નરોત્તમ નામ<RHYME_206776>.
gujarati.context: The devout worshipper seeks God's refuge in the village square, where their faith is nourished by the sacred name of Gopinath. The twice-born devotee has realized the supreme Lord as the ultimate truth, named Govind Ram.
gujarati.title_gu: પ્રકરણ ૧૨૪: વાકળ દેશના હરિજનનાં નામ કહ્યાં
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 124: Vākaḷ Deshnā Harijannā Nām Kahyā

gujarati.couplet:
એહાદિ જન રહે સેણાપરે, ભલી ભક્તિ પ્રભુજીની કરે; 
શેઠ ખુશાલ ભક્ત પાવન<RHYME_206777>, તુલસી નારાયણ હરિજન<RHYME_206777>.
gujarati.context: The virtuous people reside in the abode of God, and with pure devotion, they worship Him; Sheth is a devotee of Lord Hari, who is an incarnation of Tulasi's Narayan.
gujarati.title_gu: પ્રકરણ ૧૨૪: વાકળ દેશના હરિજનનાં નામ કહ્યાં
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 124: Vākaḷ Deshnā Harijannā Nām Kahyā

gujarati.couplet:
દ્વિજ કૃષ્ણજીને સતસંગ<RHYME_206818>, એહાદિ જન ગામ સારંગ<RHYME_206818>; 
દ્વિજ ભક્ત માહેશ્વર નામ<RHYME_206776>, ભજે હરિ રહે મિત્રજ ગામ<RHYME_206776>.
gujarati.context: The association of holy people like Krishna and the company of saints is a blessing, bringing good fortune to one's village; devotional worship of God brings friendship with Him, benefiting not just oneself but also one's community.
gujarati.title_gu: પ્રકરણ ૧૨૪: વાકળ દેશના હરિજનનાં નામ કહ્યાં
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 124: Vākaḷ Deshnā Harijannā Nām Kahyā

gujarati.couplet:
કણબી ભક્ત પ્રભુદાસ જેહ<RHYME_206813>, રણછોડ નરહર તેહ<RHYME_206813>; 
ભક્ત શેખ વસતો હરિભાઈ<RHYME_206790>, નથુ આદિક અલદર માંઇ<RHYME_206772>.
gujarati.context: Prabhudas, a devoted devotee, is like a deer in the forest of God's love; his heart beats only for Hari (God). His soul resides at Harihara (God's abode), untouched by worldly desires or attachments.
gujarati.title_gu: પ્રકરણ ૧૨૪: વાકળ દેશના હરિજનનાં નામ કહ્યાં
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 124: Vākaḷ Deshnā Harijannā Nām Kahyā

gujarati.couplet:
જન કણબી જેરામ દલા, ભક્ત હરિના બોરિયે ભલા; 
પ્રભુદાસ કણબી પાવન<RHYME_206777>, ગામ સલાદરે હરિજન<RHYME_206777>.
gujarati.context: The righteous person's heart is pure and selfless, devoted to God; a true devotee's wealth is in serving others, not personal gain.
gujarati.title_gu: પ્રકરણ ૧૨૪: વાકળ દેશના હરિજનનાં નામ કહ્યાં
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 124: Vākaḷ Deshnā Harijannā Nām Kahyā

gujarati.couplet:
કણબી જન છે ભૂધર આદ્યે, વસે ભક્ત એ ગામ પિસાદે; 
કણબી ભક્ત છે ભગતિભાઈ<RHYME_206790>, વસે જન ઝાડેસર માંઇ<RHYME_206772>.
gujarati.context: In the early days, a devotee resides in their home village with love and devotion. Later, a true devotee resides within one's own self, finding solace within.
gujarati.title_gu: પ્રકરણ ૧૨૪: વાકળ દેશના હરિજનનાં નામ કહ્યાં
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 124: Vākaḷ Deshnā Harijannā Nām Kahyā

gujarati.couplet:
જેને ઘેર પધાર્યા મોરાર<RHYME_206820>, નીર્ખી સુફળ કર્યો અવતાર<RHYME_206820>; 
જે જે લખાણાં છે આમાં જન<RHYME_206777>, તેને છે શ્રીહરિનું દર્શન<RHYME_206777>.
gujarati.context: Those who have the Lord's vision in their life, achieve success and experience the divine; whatever is written here is of Lord Srihari's revelation.
gujarati.title_gu: પ્રકરણ ૧૨૪: વાકળ દેશના હરિજનનાં નામ કહ્યાં
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 124: Vākaḷ Deshnā Harijannā Nām Kahyā

gujarati.couplet:
જે જે કહ્યાં જીભે કરી, જન વિચ્યારીને જેહ<RHYME_206813>; 
કહેતાં લાજે કવિ મને, વળી એમાં નહિ સંદેહ<RHYME_206813>.
gujarati.context: Whatever words are spoken with the tongue, they will be measured by others; only a poet knows the true intention behind them.
gujarati.title_gu: પ્રકરણ ૧૨૪: વાકળ દેશના હરિજનનાં નામ કહ્યાં
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 124: Vākaḷ Deshnā Harijannā Nām Kahyā

gujarati.couplet:
રવિ શશીની કિરણને, કોણ લેખી લેશે પાર<RHYME_206768>; 
એમ જન છે આજનાં, અગણિત ને અપાર<RHYME_206768>.
gujarati.context:
The radiant light of Ravi (sun) is carried away by the waves of time; today's people are fragmented and boundless.

(Note: I tried to maintain the original rhyme scheme and meter in my summary, but please keep in mind that translating Gujarati couplets can be a complex task and different translators may have different interpretations.)

gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 124: Vākaḷ Deshnā Harijannā Nām Kahyā

transliteration.couplet:
Vaḍā bhakta Vākaḷmā, ati māhātmī man udār; <RHYME_1>
Hari harijan uparye, jenā premno nahi pār.  <RHYME_1>
transliteration.context: A true devotee is one who has a great soul and noble heart. Without selfless love, even the name of God cannot be reached.

transliteration.couplet:
Man karma vachane karī, haribhakti upar bhāv; <RHYME_2>
Tan man dhan vaḍe, sant sevavā uchchhāv.  <RHYME_2>
transliteration.context: The couplet suggests that a person's karma is elevated by devotion to God, and their wealth and physical being are also enhanced through spiritual practices.

transliteration.couplet:
Jevā jan Vākaḷnā, tevā ja Kānam māi; <RHYME_3>
Vishavāsī vikār vinā, kapaṭ chhaḷ nahī kāī.  <RHYME_3>
transliteration.context: A person's words are their own, and they should be responsible for their intentions; without trust, even a small mistake can have great consequences.

transliteration.couplet:
Sadā e jan sukhiyā, jene prakaṭ Prabhushu prīt; <RHYME_4>
Evā jan amaḷnā, have lakhu nām kinchit.  <RHYME_4>
transliteration.context: The soul is always happy when it's connected to the divine, filled with love and joy. A true person is one who remains humble, without any self-importance or desire for fame.

transliteration.couplet:
Vaḍā bhakta Vaḍodarā māi, jene ati het Hari māi; <RHYME_5>
Kaṇabī bhakta kahīe Vanamāḷī, jeṇe bīk jagatnī ṭāḷī.  <RHYME_5>
transliteration.context: The devoted devotees are blessed by God, as they have transcended worldly attachments. The true seekers of God's love reside in the city of Vanamali, where they have conquered the entire universe.

transliteration.couplet:
Nāthjī ne vaḷī Vanamāḷī, Prabhudāsnī bhāvanā bhāḷī; <RHYME_6>
Bhagwāndās ne Kesur, Pītāmbar Bhūkhaṇ jarūr.  <RHYME_6>
transliteration.context: A king's daughter, Vanamali, is won by devotion to God, while a pious soul like Bhagvandas is drawn to the sacred color yellow.

transliteration.couplet:
Jagjīvan ne Nārāyaṇ, Prabhu Puruṣhottam ghelo jāṇ; <RHYME_7>
Eh ādi kaṇabī apār, bhaje Nārāyaṇ nar-nārya.  <RHYME_7>
transliteration.context: Narayan, the Supreme Being, has taken the form of Jagjivan; I worship Narayan with all my being.

transliteration.couplet:
Dvij bhakta Nānobhāī nām, bhaje Hari tajī man kām; <RHYME_8>
Rāmchandra Harichandrabhāī, Shobhārām kahīe shāstrīmāi.  <RHYME_8>
transliteration.context: A devotee like Dvij Bhakta Nānobhāī worships Hari with a pure heart and mind; Ramchandra Harichandrabhāī is known as Shobhārām in the scriptures.

transliteration.couplet:
Bāpu Jeṭho ne Vrajajīvan, bhakta brāhmaṇmā dhanya dhanya; <RHYME_9>
Sadāshiv Dhaneshvar nām, bhakta Khushāl Lakṣhamīrām.  <RHYME_9>
transliteration.context: The couplet praises Lord Krishna's devotee Vrajajivan and Brahma's devotee Sadashiv Dhaneshwar, both of whom are fortunate to have received the divine name.

transliteration.couplet:
Eh ādi dvij apramīt, saravene Shrī-Swāmīshu prīt; <RHYME_10>
Sheṭh Prabhudās Harajīvan, Bāpubhāī Premānand jan.  <RHYME_10>
transliteration.context: The devotee is immersed in the love of Lord Swaminarayan and has renounced worldly attachments. Their heart is filled with devotion to Him.

transliteration.couplet:
Vṛundāvan Gangādās vaṇik, bhajyā Hari te karī vivek; <RHYME_11>
Kāchhiyo Puruṣhottam jan, jeṇe nij kuḷ karyu pāvan.  <RHYME_11>
transliteration.context:
Here is a summary of the Gujarati couplet in English:

One who dedicates their life to God (Hari) develops spiritual discernment. Such a person is considered pure and worthy, as they have dedicated themselves to noble deeds.

transliteration.couplet:
Khushāl Bhāījī Raṇachhoḍ, Hari Jerām Īshvar joḍ; <RHYME_12>
Premī bhakta chhe Vāmanjībhāī, eh ādi chhe Kāchhiyā māi.  <RHYME_12>
transliteration.context: The couplet speaks of Khushal Bhaji and Hari Jeram, who have realized God; while the devoted lover Vamanji is consumed by his love for a woman named Kachhiya Mai.

transliteration.couplet:
Jan Tambolī chhe Nānabāī, tenā sut Nārāyaṇbhāī; <RHYME_13>
Dakṣhaṇī bhakta Nārāyaṇ Rāo, ḍhunḍhu Rāono ḍhaḷiyo dāo.  <RHYME_13>
transliteration.context: Jan Nānabai's son Narayan is a devotee of Lord Krishna; he gives away all his wealth to the temple priest, Dakshani Rao.

transliteration.couplet:
Chimanrāo Prabhu dvij ek, jāṇe sār asār vivek; <RHYME_14>
Dakṣhaṇī bhakta chhe Ambābāī, dvij dakṣhaṇī Dājībābhāī.  <RHYME_14>
transliteration.context: A wise person is one who understands the essence of life and makes wise decisions. A devotee of God is a true devotee, while a Brahmin's devotion is also commendable.

transliteration.couplet:
Shilāṭ Fatojī Tārāchand, Motī Hīrajī ne Amīchand; <RHYME_15>
Khatrī bhakta Nathu Ambārām, Puruṣhottam Dayārām Jerām.  <RHYME_15>
transliteration.context:
Here is a summarization of the Gujarati couplet in English:

The devotees Shilat Fatoji Tarachand and Moti Hiiroji were blessed with Amichand, while Nathu Ambaram, Purushottam Dayaraj was blessed with Jeram.

transliteration.couplet:
Nandalāl Tārāchand nām, bhakta sonī sāro Gangārām; <RHYME_16>
Bhakta sutār chhe Dharmadās, jene Prabhuno chhe vishavās.  <RHYME_16>
transliteration.context:
Here is a summary of the Gujarati couplet:

Nandalal Tarachand was a devotee who crossed the Ganges River; his son Dharmadas had complete faith in God.

transliteration.couplet:
Bhakta luvār Mūḷajī nām, harijan luvāṇo Jerām; <RHYME_17>
Bechar ādi jaṇasāli jan, kare Swāmīshrījīnu bhajan.  <RHYME_17>
transliteration.context: The devout person loves the Lord's name as much as their own, and they love God with pure devotion. They sing the song of divine love with the Lord's blessings.

transliteration.couplet:
Ehādi bahu bāī bhāī, vase shaher Vaḍodarā māi; <RHYME_18>
Joī anant parchā chamatkār, rahe magan mane nar-nārya.  <RHYME_18>
transliteration.context: This Gujarati couplet is about a brother-sister pair living in Vadodara, where they have endless joy and excitement, with the sister's mind always filled with thoughts of her loved ones. Their love and laughter are boundless like an eternal sea.

transliteration.couplet:
Kaṇabī bhakta Prāgajī dājī, vase gām Shishuvere rājī; <RHYME_19>
Koḷī bhakta Bājībhāī kahīe, eh gām Āmbodare lahīe.  <RHYME_19>
transliteration.context: A devotee's love is like a kid who is carefree in their own home, whereas another devotee's love is like a bee that buzzes around the flowers of devotion. The difference lies in the intensity and passion of their spiritual pursuits.

transliteration.couplet:
Kaṇabī bhakta chhe Māvajībhāī, kāju jan rahe Kapurāī; <RHYME_20>
Kaṇabī bhakta Prabhudāsbhāī, harijan ek Lāḍubāī.  <RHYME_20>
transliteration.context: The devotees of Lord Māvajī are like gemstones, and the people of Kapurā are aware of their value; similarly, the devotees of God Prabhudās are like precious stones, and one person in every hundred is enlightened.

transliteration.couplet:
Bhakta Metar Rāmo chhe nām, eh jan vase Chhāṇī gām; <RHYME_21>
Kaṇabī bhakta Gaṇeshjī jāṇo, koḷī bhakta Karār pramāṇo.  <RHYME_21>
transliteration.context: The devotee is known by the name Rāmo, residing in Chhāṇī village; his devotion is like Ganesha's or the ocean's depth.

transliteration.couplet:
Sheṭh bhakta Morārjībhāī, ehādi jan Sānkardā māi; <RHYME_22>
Koḷī bhakta Kānbhāī kahīe, Pratāpsingh Aṇaghaḍe lahīe.  <RHYME_22>
transliteration.context:
Here is a summarization of the Gujarati couplet in English:

Morarji and Sankarda Mai are devoted followers of God; Kanbhai and Pratapsinh have unblemished devotion to Him.

transliteration.couplet:
Kaṇabī bhakta Dayāḷjībhāī, Jādav Raṇachhoḍ Vajo Desāī; <RHYME_23>
Bājī Zaver Puruṣhottam, bāī Sākar ne vaḷī Prem.  <RHYME_23>
transliteration.context:
Here is a summarization of the Gujarati couplet in English:

The devotee's love for God is like a strong foundation, as evident from Dayāḷjībhāī and Jādav Raṇachhoḍ. This deep love is nurtured by Sākar (God) who takes care of the soul's well-being.

transliteration.couplet:
Koḷī bhakta Bājī Nārbhāī, vase gām e Goravā māi; <RHYME_24>
Kaṇabī bhakta Ruganāth nām, Jījī Viṭhal Lakṣhamīrām.  <RHYME_24>
transliteration.context:
Here is a summary of the Gujarati couplet:

The devotees are like Koḷī and Bājī Nārbhāī or Kanabī and Ruganāth, who attain spiritual realization through their devotion to God.

transliteration.couplet:
Bhakta Narahar ne Kāshībhāī, harijan chhe Raḷīyāt bāī; <RHYME_25>

transliteration.couplet:

transliteration.couplet:

transliteration.couplet:
Eh ādi bāī bhāī lahīe, vase bhakta ghaṇā Karāliye; <RHYME_28>

transliteration.couplet:

Kaṇabī bhakta Nārāyaṇ nāme, sāro jan Sejākūve gāme.  <RHYME_29>
transliteration.context: A devotee of Morariji Baja and Narayan is pure-hearted and humble; their name brings joy to all in the village.

transliteration.couplet:

transliteration.couplet:
Dvij Rāmchandr ne Nāgjī, Trikamjīe tṛuṣhṇā tajī; <RHYME_31>
Sheṭh bhakta chhe Ambāvidās, Giradhar bhāī bhaje Avināsh.  <RHYME_31>
transliteration.context: Lord Krishna, the son of Nanda and brother of Balaram, is worshiped by devotees like Sheth Bhaktas. He, along with Radha, enjoys eternal bliss.

transliteration.couplet:
Dājī Giradhar kaṇabī jan, dvij bāī Jīvī ne Ratan; <RHYME_32>
Eh ādi jan bāī bhāī, vase gām Sarasvaṇī māi.  <RHYME_32>
transliteration.context:
Here is a summarization of the couplet in English:

Dajibhai, the wise and kind Girabari, found his soulmate Jivibahen, who shone like a precious jewel; he married her in their village Sarasvani.

transliteration.couplet:
Kaṇabī bāī chhe Ḍāī Kuvar, bhaje Hari rahe Virapar; <RHYME_33>
Kaṇabī bhakta Uddhav Revādās, Bhavānīdās Prabhune pās.  <RHYME_33>
transliteration.context:
Here is a summary of the Gujarati couplet:

The devotee Kaṇabī serves Lord Hari and remains steadfast in devotion; Uddhav Revādās is his devotee, seeking shelter at Bhavānīdās's feet.

transliteration.couplet:
Puruṣhottam Jījībhāī jan, Narahar Giradhar pāvan; <RHYME_34>
Bhakta Devadās ne Trikam, paḍī Shankarne sāchī gam.  <RHYME_34>
transliteration.context: Lord Purushottam is the supreme being, and Lord Narahari Giradhar is the redeemer; devotee Devadas has faith in God Trikam, a truthful and sacred path.

transliteration.couplet:
Bhagwāndās Vrajbhāī, Nārāyaṇ ek beu bhāī; <RHYME_35>
Dvij bhakta Bāpubhāī kahīe, ehādi jan Iṭole lahīe.  <RHYME_35>
transliteration.context: Lord Krishna is considered the ultimate brother, while Bhagwan Das Vrajbhai is also a brother; both are revered as brothers by devotees. This relationship is remembered and celebrated in devotion, transcending worldly ties.

transliteration.couplet:
Kaṇabī bhakta Mādhobhāī nāme, bhaje Hari rahe Varaṇāme; <RHYME_36>
Kaṇabī bhakta chhe Garībdās, Keshavdāse tajī jūṭhī āsh.  <RHYME_36>
transliteration.context:
Here is a summary of the Gujarati couplet in English:

A devotee named Mādhobhāī worships Hari (Krishna) in Varaṇā, and another devotee Garībdās is a servant of Keshav (Krishna).

transliteration.couplet:
Dvij bhakta kahīe Kāshīrām, Jagjīvan Sāpor gām; <RHYME_37>
Bhakta vaṇik Harajīvan, Khushāl Tulasī harijan.  <RHYME_37>
transliteration.context: The devotee speaks of Kashi Ram, where the soul is awakened. The merchant Bhakta's name is Harajivan, and Khushal is his lord.

transliteration.couplet:
Narottam ādi chhe vaṇik, bhakta luvār Bechar ek; <RHYME_38>
Eh ādi jan je kahevāy, vase gām Rāmanāth māy.  <RHYME_38>
transliteration.context: A merchant Narottam is considered one, while a devotee is considered nothing; the one who has the Lord's name in their mouth is blessed. One who has the Lord's name on their lips is fortunate.

transliteration.couplet:
Dvij bhakta chhe Rāmshankar, Rataneshvar bhakta Bechar; <RHYME_39>
Kaṇabī bhakta Giradhar āde, eh bhakta rahe gām Ruvāde.  <RHYME_39>
transliteration.context: Ram Shankar is a devotee of the Lord, while Bechar is devoted to Rataneshwar; Kanabi's devotion is towards Giradhara, and his own life is spent in Ruvada.

transliteration.couplet:
Dvij bhakta ek Bhagwān, vase gām Salāḍye nidān; <RHYME_40>
Kaṇabī Khushāl Govindbhāī, Puruṣhottam Manḍāḷā māi.  <RHYME_40>
transliteration.context: A devotee has only one God to worship and that is the Lord of Salāḍye; Khushāl Govindbhāī, with a heart full of love for Puruṣhottam.

transliteration.couplet:
Dvij bhakta Shivshankar bhāī, bhakta Kuber rahe gām Pisāī; <RHYME_41>
Bhakta Bhagwān chhe kumbhār, rahe Habipar gām mozār.  <RHYME_41>
transliteration.context: Shivshankar is a devotee of Lord Shiva and lives in the village Pisai, while Bhagwan is a potter who resides in the village Mozar.

transliteration.couplet:
Alochand ne Kevaḷ soī, dvij Karuṇāshankar rahe Ḍabhoī; <RHYME_42>
Kaṇabī Kuber Manohar kahīe, rūḍā bhakta e vase Vasaiye.  <RHYME_42>
transliteration.context:
A seeker of truth is distracted by worldly desires, and a wise person remains detached; 
The devotee's heart is filled with the Lord's love, and their mind is at peace in the temple of the soul.

transliteration.couplet:
Dvij bhakta kahīe Prabhurām, ehādi jan Karadhare gām; <RHYME_43>
Kaṇabī bhakta Veṇīdās kāve, ehādi jan rahe Ṭolāvye.  <RHYME_43>
transliteration.context: The couplet describes two devotees, Dvij and Bhakta, who are compared to a pair of rivers that flow from the Lord's city to their respective villages. Their devotion is likened to the steady flow of water.

transliteration.couplet:
Dvij bhakta chhe Bhūdevbhāī, kahīe jan e Kunṭhelā māi; <RHYME_44>
Kaṇabī bhakta Meghajī jāṇo, gām Pārikhe jan pramāṇo.  <RHYME_44>
transliteration.context: A devotee is blessed with devotion from Bhudev and a humble nature from God. One who has devotion like a cloud, their village's pride is in their fame.

transliteration.couplet:
Dvij bhakta Jādav Haribhāī, chhatā bhakta chhe Chhatarālya māi; <RHYME_45>
Dvij bhakta chhe Lakṣhamīrām, kāju bhakta rahe Kārvaṇ gām.  <RHYME_45>
transliteration.context:
Here is a 1-2 line summary of the Gujarati couplet:

A devotee is always devoted to his God (Jādav Haribhāī), and another is bound to their family deity (Chhatarālya māi). Similarly, one is always true to their guru (Lakṣhamīrām) while the other remains in their village (Kārvaṇ gām).

transliteration.couplet:
Kaṇabī bhakta chhe Raṇachhoḍbhāī, Rāyajī Nathu Veribhā Desāī; <RHYME_46>
Trikam bhakta kahīe Sakhīdās, ehādi jan Karamāle vās.  <RHYME_46>
transliteration.context:
Here is a summary of the Gujarati couplet:

One who has devotion in their eyes is considered a devotee, and such is Nathu Desai; A true devotee like Trikam Bhakta is hard to find even among millions.

transliteration.couplet:
Kaṇabī bhakta Raṇachhoḍ Nānojī, Bhīkho Lālo ne Nāraṇ bājī; <RHYME_47>
Bhakta bāī bhāī eh ādye, bhaje Hari rahe Utarādye.  <RHYME_47>
transliteration.context:
A devotee's love for God is pure and true, as Naranjibhai has shown in his Bhikho Lalo composition.

The devotee sings the praise of Lord Hari with all their heart, both now and in the afterlife.

transliteration.couplet:
Kaṇabī bhakta chhe Tulajo teh, rahe gām Divermā eh; <RHYME_48>
Kaṇabī bhakta Puruṣhottam kahīe, sheṭh Hīro ne Kuber lahīe.  <RHYME_48>
transliteration.context: A devotee named Kaṇabī is a true follower of Tulājī, residing in the city of Diverma; Puruṣhottam also praises Tulājī's devotion, just like Hirō and Kubera.

transliteration.couplet:
Eh rahe Raṇāpur māi, bhaje Shyāmsundar sukhdāī; <RHYME_49>
Haribhāī kaṇabī pāvan, Vasato Harakho harijan.  <RHYME_49>
transliteration.context: The devotee dwells in the city of God, worshiping Shyamsundar's blissful form. He is cleansed by Haribhajan's pure gaze and resides with Harijans, the people of God.

transliteration.couplet:
Ehādi satasangīnī ṭoḷī, bhaje Hari rahe gām Derolī; <RHYME_50>
Kaṇabī bhakta kahīe Kāshīdās, ehādi jan Pāṇethe vās.  <RHYME_50>
transliteration.context:
Here is a 1-2 line summarization of the Gujarati couplet in English:

The devotees of God are gathered here at Derolī, singing Hari's praise; Kāshīdās says that those who have taken shelter with Him will surely reside.

transliteration.couplet:
Kaṇabī bhakta Jorobhāī jan, Puruṣhottam Bhīkho pāvan; <RHYME_51>
Vaḷī bhakta ek Vaṇārashī, eh jan Rājparāvāsī.  <RHYME_51>
transliteration.context: A devotee is like a small stone that can't be washed away by the great river of fate, and another devotee is like a beautiful flower that blooms in a palace garden.

transliteration.couplet:
Dalo Bājī Keshav Jerām, kaṇabī bhakta rahe gām Bhadām; <RHYME_52>
Dvij bhakta kahīe Sukhrām, Kāju bhakta rahe Kanyāḷī gām.  <RHYME_52>
transliteration.context: A devotee named Keshav remains in his village, Bhadām, and stays devoted to the Lord; Similarly, a twice-born devotee named Sukhrām resides in Kanyāḷī village, deeply devoted to the Lord.

transliteration.couplet:
Bhakta kaṇabī kahīe Rāyajī, vase gām Zānzar māyajī; <RHYME_53>
Dvij bhakta chhe Govindrām, kaṇabī Tulajo Narottam nām.  <RHYME_53>
transliteration.context: A devotee's heart is filled with love for God, like the fire of Zanzar in a pot; and that love is only for Lord Govinda, not for anyone else.

transliteration.couplet:
Ehādi jan rahe Seṇāpare, bhalī bhakti Prabhujīnī kare; <RHYME_54>
Sheṭh Khushāl bhakta pāvan, Tulasī Nārāyaṇ harijan.  <RHYME_54>
transliteration.context:
Here is a summary of the Gujarati couplet:

The true devotee is one who resides in the divine presence, having pure devotion; a righteous devotee is saved by God.

The devotee Khushal is a cleansed soul, a servant of Lord Naraayan.

transliteration.couplet:
Dvij Kṛuṣhṇajīne satasang, ehādi jan gām Sārang; <RHYME_55>
Dvij bhakta Māheshvar nām, bhaje Hari rahe Mitraj gām.  <RHYME_55>
transliteration.context: The couplet is about a devotee named Dvij who has spiritual gatherings with Krishna and others, and also worships Maheshwar (Shiva) while residing in the city of Mitra.

transliteration.couplet:
Kaṇabī bhakta Prabhudās jeh, Raṇachhoḍ Narahar teh; <RHYME_56>
Bhakta shekh Vasato Haribhāī, Nathu ādik Aladar māi.  <RHYME_56>
transliteration.context: A devotee is consumed by God's love and loses all worldly attachments, just like the fire that consumes wood without leaving ashes behind. One who has experienced this true devotion becomes free from worldly desires and achieves spiritual liberation.

transliteration.couplet:
Jan kaṇabī Jerām dalā, bhakta Harinā Boriye bhalā; <RHYME_57>
Prabhudās kaṇabī pāvan, gām Salādare harijan.  <RHYME_57>
transliteration.context: The devotees of God are true and pure of heart, with a strong faith that is beyond worldly bounds. The humble and lowly are lifted up by God's grace, just as the salted water of a well is elevated to become sweet.

transliteration.couplet:
Kaṇabī jan chhe Bhūdhar ādye, vase bhakta e gām Pisāde; <RHYME_58>
Kaṇabī bhakta chhe Bhagatibhāī, vase jan Zāḍesar māi.  <RHYME_58>
transliteration.context: A devotee is considered great by the Lord himself, not just by people in his village; a true devotee like Bhagatibhai is revered even by those who consider themselves higher than him.

transliteration.couplet:
Jene gher padhāryā Morār, nīrkhī sufaḷ karyo avatār; <RHYME_59>
Je je lakhāṇā chhe āmā jan, tene chhe Shrīharinu darshan.  <RHYME_59>
transliteration.context: The Lord is present within me, in the form of self-realization, and I am blessed to have a glimpse of Him; He is also visible in my dear ones' faces.

transliteration.couplet:
Je je kahyā jībhe karī, jan vichyārīne jeh; <RHYME_60>
Kahetā lāje kavi mane, vaḷī emā nahi sandeh.  <RHYME_60>
transliteration.context: When a good person does good deeds, they will be remembered and revered. A wise poet's words are not doubtful or uncertain.

transliteration.couplet:
Ravi shashīnī kiraṇne, koṇ lekhī leshe pār; <RHYME_61>
Em jan chhe ājnā, agaṇit ne apār.  <RHYME_61>
transliteration.context: The couplet describes the infinite light of knowledge shining brightly, surpassing all boundaries and limitations. It emphasizes the boundless nature of understanding and its limitless potential.
